decks.notes: The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes powerful equipment like Stoneforge Mystic to further enhance the creatures' abilities. The deck includes a mix of powerful blue control spells such as Force of Will and counterspells like Spell Pierce and Spell Snare to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares helps to control the board and clear the way for the aggressive creatures to attack.

The deck utilizes the Show and Tell combo to quickly cheat big creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield. It includes cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo from disruption, along with card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the combo pieces quickly. The deck also includes alternative ways to cheat creatures into play like Sneak Attack, providing redundancy to the main combo strategy. Additionally, the deck runs a small counterspell package to interact with the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently build up infect counters on the opponent's creatures using cards like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, while protecting your own creatures with cards like Vines of Vastwood and Berserk. The deck also includes ways to disrupt the opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, as well as card draw and mana ramp to ensure you can execute your infect plan as effectively as possible. The deck aims to win the game by dealing 10 poison counters to the opponent.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst. By using fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to play big threats ahead of schedule and apply pressure early on. Cards like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer provide efficient beaters while Endbringer offers utility. The deck also includes removal like Dismember and flexible cards like Warping Wail to deal with various threats.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria, then using spells like Exhume and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Unmask to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to accelerate the reanimation process. By utilizing this strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats before they have a chance to respond effectively.

The deck focuses on using a combination of creature ramp and removal spells to control the game until it can establish a strong board presence with powerful threats like Siege Rhino and Sigarda, Host of Herons. It also utilizes cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Stoneforge Mystic to tutor for key cards and generate card advantage with cards like Eternal Witness and Tireless Tracker. The inclusion of cards like Pernicious Deed and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional removal and utility to deal with a variety of threats in the Legacy format.

This combo dredge deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures like Ichorid, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam using cards like Golgari Thug and Golgari Grave-Troll. By utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Careful Study, the deck can quickly set up powerful plays like Dread Return and Bridge from Below. With the help of cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Cabal Therapy, the deck is able to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maximizing its own graveyard synergies. The deck's mana base of Mana Confluence, Gemstone Mine, and Cephalid Coliseum allows for consistent and explosive plays.

The deck is centered around counterspells and card advantage to control the game, with a focus on using Terminus and Council's Judgment for creature removal. It includes the Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top combo for additional control. The deck also features cards like Snapcaster Mage and Monastery Mentor for versatile threats. The goal is to control the board while generating card advantage to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win the game through incremental advantage. The inclusion of Swords to Plowshares and Engineered Explosives provides additional removal options to handle various threats.

Using a combination of disruptive creatures and land destruction spells, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Thalia and Mirran Crusader. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent and close out the game. With cards like Karakas and Phyrexian Revoker to handle difficult threats, the deck seeks to maintain control of the board and prevent the opponent from stabilizing.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to aggressively play and protect early threats such as Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Daze. The deck also includes efficient cantrips like Ponder and Gitaxian Probe to dig for the right cards, along with disruption in the form of countermagic like Force of Will and removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is built to support the three-color requirements of the deck, while also including Wasteland for land disruption.

The deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent quickly, utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressively and consistently targeting the opponent's life total, it aims to win the game before the opponent can set up their own game plan. It also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Sulfuric Vortex to punish the opponent for playing non-creature spells or gaining life. The deck's strategy is to maintain pressure and close out the game as fast as possible through a combination of creature damage and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively utilize the graveyard and sacrifice outlets to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats and disruption. By recurring creatures like Gravecrawler and Bloodghast, generating Zombie tokens with Bridge from Below, and sacrificing creatures with Goblin Bombardment, the deck can apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Cabal Therapy and Entomb further enhances this strategy by enabling targeted disruption and filling the graveyard. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Magus of the Moon and Deathrite Shaman to control the board and disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board with removal and card advantage. By using a mix of planeswalkers, card draw, hand disruption, and versatile removal spells, the deck aims to maintain tempo and outvalue the opponent in the mid to late game. The mana base is designed to support a variety of spells and ensure consistent access to all the deck's different colored mana requirements.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while utilizing mana acceleration from lands like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to disrupt opponents' game plans. Additionally, cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Dismember provide removal and combat tricks to maintain board control. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats early in the game and disrupt their strategy to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with efficient removal spells and countermagic while also utilizing powerful creatures and equipment to win the game. This strategy allows the player to control the game's pace and dictate how each match unfolds. By leveraging the synergy between Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull, the deck can generate card advantage and protect its threats effectively. With versatile cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, the deck aims to answer any threats the opponent presents while setting up its own win conditions.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures by utilizing mana acceleration from lands like Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin. The deck includes disruptive spells like Warping Wail and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also featuring aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Eldrazi Mimic to apply pressure early on. The inclusion of Chalice of the Void helps to control the opponent's spells, while cards like Karakas and Eldrazi Displacer provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around deploying big threats quickly and disrupting the opponent's strategy.
